rules.natural: If the substance mercury is banned, then the Toxic Waste Act legislation is enforced.
In the event that the substance mercury is regulated, it is not compliant.
Whenever the substance mercury is treated, it is processed.
Should the platform incinerator use the tool emissions monitor, then the platform incinerator is automated.
Either the platform incinerator uses the tool emissions monitor, or it uses the tool manual sampler.
In cases where the platform incinerator uses the tool manual sampler, if the substance mercury is processed, then it is safe.
Provided that the platform incinerator is automated, if the substance mercury is processed, it is safe.
If the substance mercury is monitored, then the tool emissions monitor is not functional.
Under the condition that the substance mercury is reported, it is monitored.
Either the Toxic Waste Act legislation requires the continuous monitoring protocol, or it requires the periodic monitoring protocol.
In the event that the Toxic Waste Act legislation requires the periodic monitoring protocol, then if the substance mercury is tracked, it is reported.

If the EPA agency enforces the Toxic Waste Act legislation, then if it is not the case that if the Toxic Waste Act legislation requires the continuous monitoring protocol, then if the substance mercury is tracked, it is reported, implies that the continuous monitoring protocol is not compliant, then the periodic monitoring protocol is compliant.
Should the Toxic Waste Act legislation mandate the secure disposal procedure, then if the substance mercury is restricted, it is not compliant.
In cases where the Toxic Waste Act legislation mandates the standard disposal procedure, then if the substance mercury is restricted, it is not compliant.
If the secure disposal procedure is implemented, then it is verified.
Either the secure disposal procedure is implemented, or the standard disposal procedure is implemented.
Under the condition that the platform incinerator is approved, the substance mercury is not allowed.
Provided that the standard disposal procedure is implemented, the Toxic Waste Act legislation mandates it.
Should the secure disposal procedure be verified, then the Toxic Waste Act legislation mandates it.
Either the Toxic Waste Act legislation grants the medical use exemption, or it grants the research use exemption.

In the event that the Toxic Waste Act legislation grants the research use exemption, then if it is not the case that if the tool emissions monitor is certified, then it is not functional, implies that the substance mercury is not compliant.
Should the medical use exemption be approved, then if the Toxic Waste Act legislation grants it, the substance mercury is exempt.
Either the medical use exemption is valid, or if the tool emissions monitor is certified, then it is not functional.
Either the research use exemption is valid, or the medical use exemption is not valid.
Whenever the platform incinerator is operational, it is approved.
Should the encapsulation procedure be effective, then it is certified.
If the encapsulation procedure is audited, then if it is certified, then if the platform incinerator employs it, then if the substance mercury is contained, it is safe.
Provided that the encapsulation procedure is inspected, then if it is certified, then if the platform incinerator employs it, then if the substance mercury is contained, it is safe.
Should the platform incinerator violate the Toxic Waste Act legislation, then if it is not operational, it is not compliant.
Either the tool emissions monitor is functional, or the Toxic Waste Act legislation is enforced.
Whenever the EPA agency implements the tool emissions monitor, the substance mercury is tracked.
Under the condition that the EPA agency implements the tool emissions monitor, it is certified.

If it is not the case that if the Toxic Waste Act legislation requires the continuous monitoring protocol, then if the substance mercury is tracked, it is reported, then the continuous monitoring protocol is compliant.
Should it not be the case that either the encapsulation procedure is audited or inspected, then it is compliant.
If it is not the case that either the encapsulation procedure is audited or inspected, then it is not compliant.
In cases where it is not the case that if the tool emissions monitor is certified, then it is not functional, then the substance mercury is compliant.
Whenever it is not the case that if the tool emissions monitor is certified, then it is not functional, the substance mercury is regulated.
Under the condition that it is not the case that if the tool emissions monitor is certified, then it is not functional, the substance mercury is restricted.

Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the Toxic Waste Act legislation requires the continuous monitoring protocol, then if the substance mercury is tracked, it is reported, then the continuous monitoring protocol is not compliant, then the periodic monitoring protocol is not compliant.
In the event that the substance mercury is not banned, then it is allowed.

Under the condition that the Toxic Waste Act legislation is not enforced, the substance mercury is contained.
